title: China Faces 'Lost Decade' Of Economic Growth
text:

Mon, Sep 28, 2015, 06:55 BST - UK Markets open in 1 hr 5 mins China Faces 'Lost Decade' Of Economic Growth By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News â€“ 12 minutes ago View Photo 

China is facing a debt explosion of unprecedented proportions which may end in a full-blown crisis or a "lost decade" for economic growth, one of the world's leading experts on the region has warned. 
Michael Pettis, finance professor at Peking University in Beijing, told us that every "growth miracle" since the Second World War has ended either in financial collapse or stagnation - without exception. 
He said the only thing that was different about China was that the scale of its imbalances was even greater than anything witnessed before. 
The warning comes amid growing concern about the stability of the Chinese economy, following the plunge in its stock markets last month and the authorities' unexpected decision to devalue their currency. 
We spoke to Professor Pettis on a week-long trip around the country, from Beijing and Shanghai to the far northwestern regions that lie closer to the Arab world than the country's capital. 
We saw a country which has transformed completely in less than a generation, with more than 200 cities of more than a million people - compared with just 35 in Europe. 
However, many are now worried about how sustainable that growth will be in the coming years. 
The authorities in Beijing have pledged to meet a 7% gross domestic product growth target in the coming years - but Professor Pettis reckons anything above 3-4% will be effectively impossible.
